title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Multimedia Presentations
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations               Multimedia Presentations            Interactive "The Road to Justice" is an interactive activity that allows you to think like an African American student in 1950. Find your way through the many challenges to a successful outcome! (712KB)         You will need Adobe Flash Player in order to view "The Road to Justice." Click here to download this program.                           Sock Hop 2013 A short video of visitors dancing to music at the Sock Hop on February 23, 2013. Spare Parts provided live music and The Kansas Ballet Academy, Accent Academy, and Chris and Vince Omni provided the moves to the locomotion, twist, and other popular dances from the 1950s and 1960s .  Duration:1 minute, 59 seconds                                2005 National Trust Award In 2005, the National Park Service and the Brown Foundation were presented the Board of Advisors' Award from the National Trust for Historic Preservation for the rehabilitation and conversion of the former Monroe School into the Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site.  Duration:1 minute, 23 seconds
